FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
ExplntnTxt: ADVANCEMENT SERVICES (ROYALL) WAS HIRED TO HELP ADVANCE OUR ANNUAL GIVING FUNDRAISING. THE EMPHASIS OF THE INITIATIVE WAS TO INCREASE ALUMNI PARTICIPATION THROUGH ACQUISITION OF NEW ALUMNI DONORS. THE COMPANY CREATED AND MANAGED OUR CALENDAR YEAR END AND FISCAL YEAR END SOLICITATIONS. THEY MADE A MAJOR ERROR BY SOLICITING A NUMBER OF OUR PRESIDENT'S COUNCIL DONORS THROUGH THE CALENDAR YEAR END SOLICITATION. THEIR EFFORTS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF NEW ALUMNI DONORS TO RMU FELL SHORT. WE TERMINATED THEIR INVOLVEMENT AT THE END OF FISCAL YEAR 13/14. WE DID GAIN VALUABLE ANALYSIS AND INFORMATION PERTAINING TO CONSECUTIVE GIVING BY ALUMNI, FIRST TIME DONOR RECOGNITION, RENEWAL RATES FROM CONSECUTIVE DONORS AND APPROPRIATE ALUMNI SEGMENTS TO TARGET. WE HAVE BEEN ABLE TO UTILIZE THIS INFORMATION IN OUR CURRENT ANNUAL FUNDRAISING STRATEGIES FOR FISCAL YEAR 14/15. WE REQUESTED A REFUND FROM ROYALL FOR THEIR MISTAKE AND THE POOR RESULTS. THIS REQUEST WAS DENIED. WE SHARED ALL THIS INFORMATION WITH THE ADMISSIONS TEAM AT RMU AS THIS GROUP UTILIZES ROYALL FOR ENROLLMENT PURPOSES. ADMISSIONS UTILIZED THIS INFORMATION TO SUCCESSFULLY NEGOTIATE A TWO (2) YEAR CONTRACT FOR THE USE OF A ROYALL TOOL, KNOWN AS DEPOSITIQ, AT NO COST TO RMU. THIS TOOL ASSISTS ADMISSION OFFICES IN ACQUIRING ENROLLMENT DEPOSITS FROM STUDENTS AND/OR THEIR FAMILIES WHO INTEND TO ENROLL. THE FEE FOR THIS TOOL IS $30,0000 PER YEAR. RMU WILL SAVE $60,000 OVER TWO YEARS AS A RESULT. THIS "MAKE GOOD" OFFERED BY ROYALL AND ACCEPTED BY THE UNIVERSITY, MORE THAN SATISFIES THE DISCREPANCY BETWEEN THE AMOUNT OF MONEY WE SPENT ON ROYALL'S FUNDRAISING SERVICES AND THE DOLLARS RAISED.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
ExplntnTxt: FUNDS SUBMITTED DIRECTLY TO CHILDREN'S MIRACLE NETWORK BY SPONSOR PARTNERS ARE REMITTED TO MEMBER HOSPITALS ON A QUARTERLY BASIS BY CHILDREN'S MIRACLE NETWORK. FUNDS REMITTED DIRECTLY TO MEMBER HOSPITALS AS A RESULT OF A CHILDREN'S MIRACLE NETWORK FUNDRAISING PROGRAM ARE REPORTED BACK TO CHILDREN'S MIRACLE NETWORK FOR THE PURPOSES TRACKING FUNDRAISING RESULTS BUT THOSE ARE DEPOSITED BY THE MEMBER HOSPITAL. MEMBER HOSPITALS PAY AN ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP FEE, WHICH DIFFERS FOR EACH MEMBER HOSPITAL AND DEPENDS LARGELY ON ITS MARKET TERRITORY POPULATION. THESE FEES ARE ANALOGOUS TO FRANCHISE FEES, WHERE HOSPITALS "OWN" MARKET TERRITORY IN WHICH THEY FUNDRAISE USING THE CHILDREN'S MIRACLE NETWORK BRAND. CHILDREN'S MIRACLE NETWORK FURNISHES FUNDRAISING MATERIALS THAT ARE ESSENTIAL TO THE CAMPAIGNS. SUCH MATERIALS INCLUDE THE PAPER ICONS, COLLATERAL MATERIALS, AND COIN CANNISTERS. MATERIALS ARE SENT DIRECTLY TO LOCATIONS OF SPONSOR PARTNERS (SUCH AS AN INDIVIDUAL COSTCO WAREHOUSE). IT IS THE RESPONSIBILITY OF EACH HOSPITAL TO PAY FOR THE COST OF THESE MATERIALS. MATERIALS COSTS ARE BILLED SEPARATE FROM THE ANNUAL MEMBERSHIP FEE AND ARE SENT INTERMITTENTLY DEPENDING ON THE FREQUENCY OF THE CAMPAIGNS.

HOWEVER, BWF DOES NOT PERFORM SPECIFIC FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES OR SOLICITATIONS ON BEHALF OF THE UNIVERSITY; THUS, THE AMOUNT OF CONTRIBUTIONS RECEIVED ATTRIBUTABLE TO BWF'S SERVICES CANNOT BE REASONABLY DETERMINED.;

ExplntnTxt: FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES DEMPSEY CHALLENGE - THIS EVENT OCCURS ANNUALLY IN OCTOBER AND OCCUPIES A YEAR-LONG PLANNING AND EXPENSE CYCLE. DUE TO THE OVERLAPPING YEAR CYCLE OF THIS EVENT, EACH REPORTED TAX YEAR WILL HAVE A PORTION OF REVENUE AND EXPENSES ATTRIBUTABLE TO THE EVENT OCCURRING WITHIN THE REPORTABLE TAX YEAR, AS WELL AS SOME EXPENSES, SPONSORSHIPS, REGISTRATIONS AND DONATIONS ASSOCIATED WITH THE FOLLOWING YEAR'S EVENT. AS SUCH, THE AMOUNT REPORTED WITH THIS RETURN IS NOT REPRESENTATIVE OF A SINGLE EVENT'S PROCEEDS; RATHER IT IS A REPORT OF ACTIVITY ENCOMPASSING OVERLAPPING PERIODS FOR AN EVENT THAT CROSSES A REPORTABLE TAX PERIOD.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Schedule G, Part II, Fundraising Events
ExplntnTxt: The Women & Science program is an important outreach and fundraising initiative of The Rockefeller University. Comprised of a wide circle of friends and benefactors, Women & Science provides support for education and career advancement of scientists in biomedical research and related fields. One component of this initiative is the annual Women & Science Lecture and Luncheon.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Form 990, Schedule G, Part II, Fundraising Events
ExplntnTxt: The Parents & Science program in an important outreach and fundraising initiative of The Rockefeller University. Parents & Science sponsors events that feature distinguished Rockefeller University scientists and eminent guest speakers from such fields as psychology, medicine, education, and the social sciences. A major focus is emerging discoveries and biomedical breakthroughs that are improving the health and well-being of children. One component of this initiative is the annual Celebrating Science Benefit.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE G, PART I, LINE 2B, COLUMN (V)
ExplntnTxt: THE UNIVERSITY PAID RUFFALO CODY TO ACT AS OUR ANNUAL FUND PHONATHON AGENTS DURING FY 2013-2014. AS SUCH, RUFFALO CODY CONTACTED ALUMNI, PARENTS, AND FRIENDS OF THE UNIVERSITY SOLICITING PLEDGES OF FINANCIAL SUPPORT OF OUR INSTITUTIONAL MISSION. IN PARTICULAR, THEY SOUGHT GIFTS IN SUPPORT OF THE MARYWOOD SCHOLARSHIP FUND TO PROVIDE RESOURCES TO UNDERWRITE FINANCIAL AID AND SCHOLARSHIP AWARDS MADE BY THE UNIVERSITY TO DESERVING STUDENTS. IN THE COURSE OF THEIR WORK, RUFFALO CODY ADVISED THESE SUPPORTERS OF NEW AND EXCITING CHANGES TO PROGRAMS AND FACILITIES AT MARYWOOD. IN ADDITION, THEY OBTAINED INFORMATION CONCERNING CHANGES TO BIOGRAPHIC AND DEMOGRAPHIC INFORMATION OF THE INDIVIDUALS CALLED. RUFFALO CODY ACTED STRICTLY IN THE ROLE OF OUR AGENT IN SECURING PLEDGES OF SUPPORT. THE PROCESSING OF ALL PLEDGE PAYMENTS AND CREDIT CARD TRANSACTIONS WERE HANDLED BY UNIVERSITY EMPLOYEES.
